page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES
page.content: The majority of the people of working age living in the area are engaged in farm work including contract work for other farmers. Most farms are mixed farms and on more than one there are three generations working. Many of the wives of farmers keep poultry, usually on free range, and sell the eggs at the house or local markets in Okehampton or Hatherleigh, each about four miles away. In the short summer season there is some work catering for tourism, either in offering farmhouse bed and breakfast or self-catering holiday flats but employment is mainly within the family. Others must travel to Okehampton or further to find employment other than farming. There is also a transport undertaking in the block employing some HGV drivers.
